concept.title: Delivery Guarantee
concept.shortdesc: When you configure a pipeline, you define how you want data to be treated: Do you want to prevent the loss of data, or do you want to prevent the duplication of data?

conbody.p:
delivery guaranteepipeline propertypipelinesdelivery guaranteeThe Delivery Guarantee pipeline property offers the following choices:
At least once The ensures that the pipeline processes all data. If a failure causes the to stop while processing a batch of data, when restarts, it reprocesses the batch. This option ensures that no data is lost. But if the failure occurs as the writes data to destinations, up to one batch data might be duplicated in the target.
At most once The ensures that data is not processed more than once. If a failure causes the to stop while processing a batch of data, when it starts up, it begins processing with the next batch of data. This option ensures duplicate data is not written to the target due to reprocessing. But if the failure occurs as the writes data to destinations, up to one batch of data might not be processed.
